isis.stitle: BP-R1 BOBTAIL BRAKE PROPORTIONING RELAY VALVE AND LQ-5 BOBTAIL LIMITING VALVE - SERVICE CHECKS - BP-R1 OPERATION TEST

svcproc.title: BP-R1 OPERATION TEST
svcproc.para: To properly test the function of the BP-R1, a pair of test gauges or gauges of known accuracy must be used.

step1.para: Park the vehicle on a level surface and block the wheels and/or secure the vehicle by a means other than the air brakes.
Drain air pressure from all vehicle reservoirs.
Install a "tee" at the BP-R1 service port and at one of the delivery ports, then install a gauge in each.

Connect the tractor service emergency "glad hands" (hose couplings) that have been plugged, or alternatively, to a trailer. Build the tractor system air pressure to governor cut-out and make 4 to 5 full brake applications. Check the brake fittings at the BP-R1 for leaks. Correct leak conditions noted.

With the trailer supply valve (dash control with red octagonal-shaped button) and system park control (dash control with yellow diamond-shaped button) activated for tractor/trailer operation, apply, HOLD, then release the brakes several times varying the application pressures while watching the reaction of the gauges installed on the BP-R1. Note that a prompt application of air occurs, that the air pressure is sustained during the HOLD, and that the air pressure quickly is released when the brakes are released.

Check the BP-R1 differential pressure by applying 10 psi to the service port and noting the pressure registered at the delivery port. Subtract delivery port pressure from the 10 psi service pressure (applied to the service port) to obtain the differential. The measured differential should be approximately 4 psi for the BP-R1 valve installed by International.
Make and hold a full (100 psi or greater at service port gauge) brake application and note that full pressure (100 psi or greater at the delivery port) is delivered to the brake chambers.

Activate the dash mounted trailer air supply valve for bobtail tractor operation. Then make a very slow brake application, increasing the pressure at the BP-R1 gradually to 20 psi while watching the resulting change in pressure at the delivery port gauge. Note that the delivery port pressure rises to approximately 5 to 10 psi and remains constant while service continues to rise to 20 psi. Release the application.

Make another brake application and slowly increase the pressure at the BP-R1 service port to between 60 and 70 psi while observing the delivery port gauge. Note that when service port pressure rises to between 20 and 30 psi, delivery pressure begins to rise above the initial pressure noted in step 6. The rise of delivery pressure should be at a proportioned rate of approximately 3:1. At 70 psi service pressure, delivered pressure should be 15 to 25 psi.
Make a full brake application and note that both test gauges register the same pressure.
Remove the test gauges from the BP-R1.

svcproc.para: If the BP-R1 fails the OPERATION TEST repair or replace the valve.
